text: Hi! I'm trying to make the slider example (<http://juliaplots.org/MakieReferenceImages/gallery//sliders/index.html>) work using WGLMakie in jupyter lab. After a very long time, the axis and slider bars are displayed, but none of the points on the graph nor the sliders themselves are shown. It is also nonresponsive and I get warning: error in websocket handler. Can anyone help me figure out how to solve this?

elements.text: Hi! I'm trying to make the slider example (

) work using WGLMakie in jupyter lab. After a very long time, the axis and slider bars are displayed, but none of the points on the graph nor the sliders themselves are shown. It is also nonresponsive and I get warning: error in websocket handler. Can anyone help me figure out how to solve this?

text:
<@U66SGEWAC> would give you a better answer, but as far as I understand, WGLMakie doesn't have sliders implemented yet

However, you can use JSServe

Have a look at <https://github.com/SimonDanisch/JSServe.jl/blob/master/examples/basic_offline_makie.jl>
